title: Perfect
comment: Absolutely perfect app. The only thing keeping me from giving it 5 stars is the icon. It just doesn't look that good.
Lots of usage example meanings too...thanks Nikolay...hope your Japanese adventure continues!
Doesn't translate for me, but it is the only app that saw words in a picture!

title: Makes it easy to find kanji
comment: The handwriting recognition in this app is the best I have found. It finds the right kanji every time. There are still some technical issues with it though. Some of the icons at the bottom of the app do not work and the history and favorite icons are swapped. It also doesn't do a very good job of keeping search history

title: Perfect!
comment: It gets the job done, and it syncs well with Anki, too!

title: great but...
comment: Awesome app, i'm just having trouble wth studying frequent kanji, and I am wondering, in the individual kanji info, what is the frequency rating, and how does it work?
It is 'the rank-order frequency of occurrence of the kanji in Japanese', based on analysis of some corpus of contemporary Japanese text (newspapers, etc.). See the kanjdic home page for details.

title: Kanji
comment: เรียน

title: Good
comment: Reasonable app size, clean gui, good design. Love the widget. Works, never had a crash.

title: Nice app
comment: Very good app, one thing that is missing is the 'stroke order' option from the kanji screen. This option exists in 'Kanji Recognizer', but because of that i have to switch from one app to another to have the stroke order. Would be nice to have the stroke order button available in WWWJDIC, if you purchased the premium version of Kanji Recognizer.
The stroke order option has always been available, just press the pencil icon at the bottom of the screen. No need to switch apps.
Its good it has multiple results for a single search and explains it. Good job

title: Best of the best
comment: A wonderful app. The hand writing recognition is amazingly useful.

title: Two problems
comment: Was working great for the first day but now it wont let me open settings and the orc stopped working completely

title: Great kanji lookup up
comment: Great app with a lot of info on individual kanji, on and kun reading, stroke order, radical, etc. The only thing I can see that could use improvement is compound look up. It is pretty much a disorganized jumble. Fortunately it uses the same numbing system as my dictionary so I can cross reference pretty easily.

Compound lookup is supported, but you need a Japanese IME for input. If you are referring to handwriting input,  you can use Kanji Recognizer (premium) + Simeji/Google IME (any IME that supports Simeji's 'mushroom' protocol)
Kanji of the day widget stopped working so I removed it but the widget didn't appear again.
The widget does not appear automatically, you have to add it from your launcher.

title: Awesome
comment: This app is just amazing

title: Good
comment: Could be better with recognition but its still fun to try!

title: lot of errors
comment: All the settings are not working and returning errors. Using nexus 7 2013on android 4.4.3
Yes, that's due to a new security requirement for 4.4. I've just released 2.3.8.1 which fixes this.

title: This program is great
comment: but Japanese is often written vertically, and the OCR function only recognizes horizontal orientation.
The OCR Web service the app uses does not support vertical text. When it does, support will be added to the app too.

title: Best Japanese kanji recognition app out there
comment: Excellent!!   update: the latest update completely ruined the ocr feature... it returns zero results even when im trying out super simple kanjis like 一 or 女. Please fix.. or is there a way to undo an update?
OCR works just as before. Recognition depends on font size, background, etc. It works best with black text on white background, with standard fonts.
Good

title: One of the best.
comment: By far, this is one of the most useful apps for Japanese. Occasionally, finding the right definition can be a bit of a hunt, but the overall content is staggeringly great.

title: Great app
comment: Still brilliant

title: great
comment: would be the best if widget can show the kanji on favorite

title: great app
comment: home screen is a little messy

title: Good
comment: It's good. But i think it's better if we can use it offline.

title: Great
comment: What's not to love?

title: Surprisingly great
comment: I downloaded this and didn't use it immediately. I am surprised how great this dictionary is. Three ways to search: word, kanji, or sentence examples. I wish I could upload screenshots to show what I mean. Great for anyone studying Japanese.

title: My friends i miss them
comment: I really love doing this

title: OCR doesnt work!
comment: Tried several images- they all failed or gave incorrect translations
OCR works best with printed text, black on white. Results may vary depending on font and size.

title: The Perfect translator
comment: A perfect app that functions like wwwjdic website

title: Excellent.
comment: This is, by far, the best English/Japanese application I've ever used.

title: Very good
comment: Thanks for the amazing and extremely useful app. Definitely 5 stars. One more feature that would be nice is an option to display furigana over kanji in the example sentence search listings. It would greatly help those of us using sentence methods to fly through readings/recordings more quickly as we wouldn't have to slow down for unknown kanji.

title: Misleading
comment: This is in Chinese and doesnt give the Japanese of the word wanted...
Words are given in Japanese kanji with reading using Katakana (for onyomi) and Hiragana (for kunyomi). You need to be able to read at least Hiragana to make use of the app.

title: Great!
comment: Everything about this app is good, but it would be perfect if it can read out the kanji in japanese as well.
You need to install and configure a Japanese text-to-speech provider to enable this. See the FAQ for details: https://code.google.com/p/wwwjdic/wiki/FAQ

title: great app!
comment: i've been using this app since i can remember. Now i got a new phone (samsung galaxy mini) but there's no widget option...  i loved that ''kanji of the day'' widget.... can someone help me out please..? thanks in advance!
Widget is still available, you just have to find out how to add widgets with your launcher. There is usually a 'Widgets' tab when you open the app drawer (where all the apps are listed).

title: Excellent
comment: The expert's dictionary

title: Excellent
comment: Very helpful for Lerner's.

title: Excellent recognizer apps
comment: Recognize kanji image and poor kanji handwriting.  5 star!

title: good app
comment: Good app.  Only issue is it never saves my settings.  Everytime I use it I see the same pop up messages and my keyboard pops up despite previously changing the setting.   The pop up messages are *o.k.*, but I HATE the pop up keyboard.  Still, even though that's a bit annoying, this is the best dictionary in terms of content and search.options (which is what counts).  Still some bugs, but excellent work.
Thank You!

title: Very good
comment: Good now.  Had a problem with phone randomly rebooting when pasting text into this app, fixed in Android update.

When exactly does it crash? The app doesn't do anything hardware-specific, so it is very likely that you are hitting a bug in your phone's OS. If you don't need the TTS feature, simply click 'Don't ask again' to disable the prompt.

title: Great app!
comment: The UI is a bit overwhelming, but the app is great nonetheless. I've been using it for a couple of years now, without a single glitch. Well done!

title: The best Japanese app ever!
comment: I absolutely love this dictionary.   The only thing that could make It better would be if I could favorite example sentences so I can find them again later.  Keep up the good work!

title: Good
comment: I love this :)

title: Helped me learn a lot, thanks!
comment: As the title says, it really helped me learning a lot. Great application so far. However, I think there's still a place to improve in terms of the look of the application.
WWWJDIC is undergoing periodic maintenance. Choose another mirror in Settings or just wait it out. It usually doesn't take too long.

title: Simple
comment: It's great as a simple dictionary, but anyone looking for serious studying need to look elsewhere. I've used this app for a long while and it's fast, responsive and works good. I miss an offline mode and a light theme setting, however.

title: Quite good
comment: Works well, but i have trouble with the ocr. Doesn't seem to support vertical text very well.
The OCR service the app uses (WeOCR) doesn't currently support vertical text. App support will be added once the service allows for recognizing vertical text.
Great!

title: 良かった
comment: Almost excellent except I cannot use it offline, but overall ilove this app, useful and free.

title: The best free dict out there
comment: Android GalaxySIII  Saved me on numerous occasions out in the society of Japan.

title: Lovely Stuff !
comment: If you're already a student of Japanese, then this should be a familiar tool on the web. Love it.

title: Great
comment: Simply a must
Very nice

title: BAKA
comment: Idiotic.  An English interface app for learning kanji yet the TTS doesn't pronounce the kanji;. it pronounces the English definition. Are the developers daft,  or just high? once again update did not fix the tts . uninstalling.

title: Samsung Galaxy S2
comment: Doesn't display any kanji in search.list etc. probably a bug in the font, when I type kanji somewhere else, they work just fine, just this app dysfunctions, rendering it useless completely

title: Great little dictionary
comment: Love the handwriting recognition, but why is there no audio reading for the japanese words but there is for the English definitions? What is the point of having English definitions read out loud? I also wish it came with korean to japanese direct translation.

title: Meh...
comment: I'm guessing the only reason this app has gotten such good reviews is because none of the raters have used Kotoba for iOS.  It's much cleaner-looking, easier to use, and produces better results based on searches.  What gives!?  I'm forced to carry my Android phone and iPod Touch around with me daily on the job in Japan.  Plenty of room for improvement and I'm really hoping it happens soon.

title: Awesome
comment: Very useful. Constantly improving.

title: Great but
comment: Needs offline support...

title: Recent update issue
comment: Since the most recent update, I now can't do anything with this app. A server mirror issue comes up when I try to use it. I used this app almost daily for more than a year, and have loved it. Please fix urgently. HTC One.
Wow!its help me a lot..

title: Great
comment: Extremely useful for learners.

title: Damngood
comment: This application is seriously amazeballs. I live in Japan and (knowing little Japanese ) this has rescued my bacon from some serious misunderstanding.

title: one REALLY ANNOYING BUG, please fix!
comment: This app is amazung. I use it every day as I live in Japan. But, ONE bug that youve had ever since the beginning , is, it is impossible to jump from あ section where you write words, to the 文 example sentence section. The keyboard.does NOT come.up. I have to.click on the middle section, 漢 before going to the next section. This is a really irritating bug, please fix. Other than that, no complaints. That is the only reason. I give this 3 out of 5. If it is fixed I will gladly give it a 5.
Exceptionally good.  I really like the update.

title: Very useful
comment: I am advanced level and this dictionary really helps when i am stuck as the search its so powerful.

title: Great app
comment: Great app, but suddenly my kanji of the day widget is broke and keeps coming up with an error... please fix, I liked it..

title: On-line :-(
comment: Would have been very useful if usable off-line. NOT working when no network. Is there a copy of Jim Breen's dictionnary avaliable off-line ?

title: Matt
comment: Ok

title: Love it, but has issues
comment: Love this app, but it has problems. OCR from camera always fails on my nexus s. Not at all intuitive interface, you have to look for user tips online. Hand draw kanji recognition is brilliant.

title: impressive
comment: Very good app. inclusion and solid implementatio of ocr has made this one killer app. thankyou. The only issue I have is that it doesn't eork eithought the internet. is there some way to have a fallback dictionary?

title: Galaxy Nexus
comment: Love this app! But it would be awesome if we could look up multiple kanji with the HR kanji recognizer. Like, draw one, select it, draw another and get the reading/meaning for the two together. Thank you!

title: Very good
comment: Very comprehensive and useful. Thanks a lot!

title: Jdic
comment: Great!

comment: awesome

comment: excellent app. however on text translation, english meanings and some of japanese gets cut off on old htc models because of screen resolution. maybe introduce a scroll function?

comment: Around!
Sometimes a little quirky, but works well and has excellent searches.

title: Perfect
comment: As good as an electronic dictionary. Nothing else that I need. Recommended + +
Works well.
Widget on launcher caused looping force close til it was uninstalled. Careless bug to have...

title: Skeptical
comment: Why does this app require acres to my location and cameras? Otherwise I would give a thumbs up.
Snoops IMEI number continuously.

title: Beautiful
comment: This is such a great app for such an amazing project.  Please support this dev.  A widget would be great too!!! Hint hint.
Very useful!

title: Good.
comment: I like it, unfortunately the recommended TTS app is not available in the United States market - banned from being downloaded by in the US. Short-sighted developers who think only people in Japan would want something Japanese... But that's not under the control of WWWJDIC's developer, I just wish he'd have recommended something that could actually be downloaded by those who need an English-Japanese dictionary.

title: Poor, unrelated and unsorted results
comment: When you search for something, it often displays dozens of totally unrelated results, while the word that actually matches your search is either missing or hidden far down amongst irrelevant entries.

title: Absolutely useless
comment: Unless you already read Japanese I wouldn't bother. I was hoping to translate some phrases from the manual of my Japanese import car. Useless.
Love it! Very useful! Only issue: Kanji of the day won't automatically update even when I set it to do so.

title: Great but
comment: Great but the handwritten kanji prediction does not work. I have to use the separate kanji recognizer if I want the handwritten kanji prediction.

title: Will be useful for upcoming trip
comment: I've been studying Japanese for over 9 years. This will be useful for my trip to Japan in December and January. The handwritten Kanji is particularly good. Now all I need is my tablet for everything and I can use my electronic dictionary if this app lets me down because that also has handwritten kanji with a stylus.

title: Great app
comment: Handwriting recognition for kanji is especially useful

title: Awesome.
comment: Absolutely amazing app. A. is a moron, Don't select "romanized Japanese " for English words and it works brilliantly
v2.1.1 Nice app. Recommend.

title: Superb!
comment: OCR is great, lookup is perfect. Recommended N2 TTS not available to dl from Market in the USA (?!) but that's not Ni's fault!

title: Great!
comment: The best dictionary by far! The kanji compound function is extremely useful

title: Must have
comment: Love it!

comment: By far the best Japanese dictionary on Android. Easily comparable to my favorite on the web which is popjisyo. ;)

title: BEST!
comment: Very comprehensive and easy to search for words.Works for my Xperia Arc.

title: Perfect
comment: Greatness, as expected from this site. I only wish all languages had their own Jim Breen sites and apps.
Needs network connection.

title: @j
comment: It does not waste resources, that is how Android caches processes. Background service may start periodically to update widget, but is not always on.

title: won't stay dead
comment: this app only works w/ good network connection. it is an undead app: it will start itself even when you don't use it if force-closed, wasting resource

title: doesnt work anymore
comment: it was good until the last update, then it stopped working, can't even look up simple words in English or Japanese. Samsung Galaxy S.
Can't I use the Write Kanji input for multiple kanjis.Handwriting keyboards are not that accurate to write kanji. your Write Kanji input is far better
Excellent app with surprisingly good ocr. It would be nice if I could ocr images already on my phone gallery!
Works well
@sanjuro Read explinations, no reason not to install!! This app has everything you need, only Japanese app I use. And I'm studying Japanese at uni!!
Absolutely wonderful & updated frequently! :-) give it a try!
Excellent !!!
Drains phone battery checking for updates... The android market already does this.
the first handwriting-supported jp dict app that runs very well on my defy! very helpful app , great thanks!
THE BEST APP dict kanji so far.. support ocr too .. amazing! Cannot thank u enough
Wish it had text glossing like the website.
Would love the option to download and use dictionaries offline.
Nice app but had enough of apps that want full internet and access to accounts when it's totally unnecessary imo
I use this app almost every day studying kanji. Handwriting recognition and interface design are great. Just bought donate version.
Widget not showing as an option on my phone.
Excellent app. Developer is incredibly responsive. Highly recommend. Will purchase Donate version! A++

title: Kanji recognizer works well
comment: You must get the stroke order right for the kanji recognizer to work. If you can manage that - and it is a big if for people starting out - the OCR picks out the word more often than not. I have both Aedict and WWWJDIC installed and would say that the content for Aedict is far richer but WWWJDIc's kanji recognizer works better.
The dictionary works just fine but the daily kanji widget always dissapears after i restart the phone. I hv to reinstall the app.
FC upon taking picture for OCR (desire hd)
Brilliant application. Can link to examples in context and can break down any word into hiragana (inc. compounds). Add etymology links?(Eg Zhongwen?)
This awesome app just keeps getting better and better...multi-radical lookup is very good on this.
I love this app, but I am having constant problems with the Kanji of the Day widget. Always has errors or completely disappears from my widget list...
Great functionality, easy to use. Must have.
Most excellent. App has grown so much since I last reviewed it. They grow up so fast... Anyway, upping my rating from 4 to 5 stars! Yay!
Great app. Haven't been able to get the OCR to work at all yet.
Great idea and combination of features. Keep up the good work. Desire
Worthless. Does not even translate a simple word like "cat" in romanized English. Deleted!
Love the app! Very useful with Simeji or Han-writing IMEs. Kanji widget is great with limit to common characters option.
If server times out try another mirror. If you can't read hiragana you shouldn't be messing with kanji.
Totally WORTHLESS to tourists and beginners in Japanese. Doesn't show Romaji translations of Japanese. Jim Breen's stuff is garbage.
good application, would be better if it could also work offline, option to use local data files
Great application! Add a word of the day widget and animated stroke order (instead of kanji lines just appearing, show them actually being written)plz
Ocr for taken picture gives wrong result 90% of the time
Best kanji recognition. The dictionary itself is obviously awesome.
Love Jim Breens server and all the work theyve put in over the years. This app is better than expected too. However, I found it by accident
Parallel kingdom is the best game hands down. Use the code LULJZ at the end of the tutorial and you will get extra swag!!!
Why does this app need access to account info?
Thank you.
No multiradical searching, and some kanji don't even display (on a Japanese android no less). Kotoba! for iphone is a much better version of wwwjdict.
Awesome...been using for a few months. Goes well with a side of Kanji Recognizer (same company) 5* HTCevo
Why doesn't the kanji widget update daily?
Very good can find all the words I need
Beautiful app. The kanji lookup is a godsend. Search results need more relevancy though.
Handwritten kanji recognition is awesome. If only the camera OCR worked so well.
Great for kanji. Draw kanji on a touchscreen and it can recognise with or without stroke order.
All it still needs is a way to translate whole sentences like google translate
Amazing
Icon is so ugly it makes me want to uninstall every time I look at it. But I don't because the program is great. Please at least change shortcut name.
OCR works really well. Nice job.
Awesome. Just wish I knew what the random acronyms stood for
Best dictionary out there, awesome hand written kanji recognition.
Great handwritten kanji recognition
Update made hand writing feature much better! Also, set a mirror in settings for best response. The default was set to australia. XD
OCR does not get past crop phase on moto droid and some kanji not logged into stroke order (unsearchable in handwritten part) Otherwise, excellent app
awsome! i love ut!
Pretty much awesome, I use it everyday!
Love this app especilly the drawing pad, only the camera has some problems focusing on the htc magic
Would be 5 stars if the dictionary was accessed locally rather than over http. Too many dropped connections. Unreliable.
Best.
Adding the handwritten kanji recognition to my most trusted J-E dictionary easily makes this a 5-star app.
such a great app, i was almost on edge to get one of those rly expensive electronic japanese dictionaries b4
